attributes.action: To have a second referendum on Britain leaving the EU
attributes.background:
It's no secret that a vast amount of people who voted to leave the EU didn't realise what they were voting for. 

The Leave campaign said that leaving would create new trade deals, strengthen the economy and public services and reduce the number of incoming immigrants. But this is not happening.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May has really struggled so far in Brexit negotiations and time is running out. She's failing to secure trade deals and my personal biggest fear is the Irish Border, this could lead to a United Ireland.

May has lost support not only from the Cabinet but the whole nation. I'm calling for a second referendum, because if you voted to remain or to leave we need a final say. The Brexit decision was so tight and I just think that it help everyone if there was a second vote. Sign if you agree.

attributes.action: universal credit to pay rent cost during the 4week period before first payment
attributes.background: Universal credit is causing a big problem for people falling into rent arrears at the beginning the claim by making the claimant have to wait an initial period of 4-5 weeks before issuing the first Payment in which rent arrears are building up and already people are at risk of Losing their homes.
attributes.additional_details: There used to be help for when people returned to work by giving a grace period of 1 months extra housing benefit to help with the transition from jobseekers allowance to work before the housing benefit was cancelled. Could something like this be actioned?  especially when you are moving people from an old existing benefit into the new umbrella of universal credit and rent arrears will have started accumulating. Was this 4-5wk period never thought about?! and the awful knock on effect to follow?

attributes.action: Lower the tax for fuel so it’s more affordable
attributes.background: The fuel prices in the uk are reaching an all time high, other country’s pay way less on fuel! This needs to be actioned now !

attributes.action: Reform use of non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) in employment
attributes.background: Settlements that include NDAs remain secret. This can perpetuate a culture of bullying and victimisation and allow abuse to remain unchallenged. All NDAs should explicitly say that employees or ex-employees are allowed to talk about any bullying and harassment they might have seen or experienced.
attributes.additional_details: The opposite view, that payments routinely reward false allegations, also leads to the same conclusion. These NDAs are inappropriate.

attributes.action: Introduce conjugal visits in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In many other countries conjugal visits are permitted. However, in the U.K. it is not permitted. the biggest advantages of allowing conjugal visits is prisoners tend to follow the rules for fear of losing their right to have a visit. Moreover, the biggest advantage is families no longer suffer.
attributes.additional_details: Conjugal visits are allowed in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Denmark, Germany, india, Israel, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, and Spain. In the US, conjugal visits are not allowed in Federal prisons, but California, New York, Mississippi, Washington, and Connecticut permit them.

attributes.action: Introduce hypothecated tax to support NHS by regulated distribution of cannabis.
attributes.background:
The NHS needs far more money funded from central government in order to continue to provide for everyone's physical and mental health needs in the U.K.
Evidence from some states in the US including Colorado demonstrate that legislative amendments regarding cannabis have produce substantial revenue.
attributes.additional_details:
Colorado has an geographical area similar to the United Kingdom with a population of 5 million, similar in size to Scotland. The Colorado Department of Revenue began collecting data in February 2014. In 2017 over $247 Million was raised. The total economic impact has been calculated at over $1.5 Billion.
Please refer to website link:
www.colorado.gov/pacific/revenue/colorado-marijuana-tax-data

attributes.action: Ask the government to increase funding for osteoporosis
attributes.background:
The information that is out there is vague nothing definitive also testing not done until too late in most cases 
Like lots of diseases early diagnosis is the way forward

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory 42 year prison sentences for using a knife against another.
attributes.background: The knife crime epidemic in the UK is out of control.  There is at present no suitable deterrent and with the increasing lawlessness and lack of visible policing, evildoers are increasingly prepared to threaten and use a knife against a fellow citizen.  Knife injuries for victims are life sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN04304

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/uk-knife-crime-police-gang-violence-stabbings-record-figures-a8589626.html

https://www.statista.com/statistics/864736/knife-crime-in-london/

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/crimeandjustice/bulletins/crimeinenglandandwales/yearendingmarch2018

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use parent-child spaces if you do not have a child with you
attributes.background: I would like parent-child spaces to be considered with the same respect as disabled spaces and be offered as a matter of course in all public car parks. As a mother of 2 infants I am left to struggle getting them out of the car in an unsafe space because people without a child use the child spaces.
attributes.additional_details: There is a safety issue as the extra space allowed in a child space means children can get in and out safely without being right next to the moving wheels of other vehicles. Additionally, these spaces are often closer to the trolley park or business entrance meaning if you have to get a special trolley to use or are carrying infants you don't have to go too far from the car in order to be able to do this safely. Having to carry children, baby bags and your shopping is very difficult already!

attributes.action: Stop the bedroom tax and stop homelessness increasing.
attributes.background:
The government should stop the bedroom tax and help the vulnerable on
limited budgets. Homelessness is on the increase and this tax is helping
towards those figures due to people not been able to pay for the rent shortfall out of their limited benefits.
attributes.additional_details: With the universal credits system taking 6 weeks before getting paid, the bedroom tax is another expense that people are struggling with and making people homeless.

attributes.action: Introduce free flu jabs for people using Lithium Carbonate for Bipolar disorder
attributes.background: Lithium Carbonate is considered to be the gold standard for controlling the symptoms of bipolar disorder, however, the symptoms of flu including diarrhoea, vomiting, dehydration and fever are exactly those which can cause Lithium toxicity which can quickly become fatal.
attributes.additional_details: By providing flu vaccinations, the government will be taking a pre-emptive step, reducing the risk of lithium toxicity while, at the same time, reducing the number of hospital beds taken up and allowing treatment of flu victims who require it.

attributes.action: Make all new school buses zero-emission vehicles from 2020.
attributes.background: Over a million children in the UK use school transport provided by transit buses, contracted coaches, minibuses and taxis each day. We’re asking the government to ensure the vehicles carrying our children to school don’t add to the already harmful levels of air pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
Air quality in the UK has been described as a public health emergency contributing to 40,000 premature deaths per year and it's small children who are affected the most. Electric school bus motors
produce zero emissions. This means cleaner, healthier air while
kids wait to board the bus & inside the cabin.

attributes.action: Remove the verbal option from Food Information Regulations on Allergens.
attributes.background:
With so many people now suffering food allergies and other food related conditions, it is not acceptable for anyone to rely on word of mouth about the ingredients used.
It is not possible for staff to remember every ingredient in a dish, and there needs to be documentation to prove due diligence.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, it is considered acceptable for food businesses to provide allergen information verbally, however, with the high staff turnover for which the hospitality industry is renowned, this is not adequate, safe, reliable, or practical. 
It is much more practical to provide written documents with full ingredients lists, to use standardised recipes, and have staff trained on accredited courses. In a court of law, a business must 'prove due diligence', this, surely, cannot be achieved verbally.

attributes.action: Make the NHS exempt from paying business rates.
attributes.background: NHS Hospitals are facing rising business rates whilst private hospitals are able to register as a charity saving them around 80% on their business rates.

attributes.action: Make CCTV mandatory on streets where crime doubles in 6 months.
attributes.background: Hotspots of escalating crime figures are indications of organised crime where false reporting and framing of individuals for crimes they didnt commit can become more likely. CCTV is advisable on streets where crime figures double in 6 months
attributes.additional_details: Sign the petition and change the law so CCTV stops gangs lying to the police

attributes.action: Make Humanist weddings legally recognised in England and Wales
attributes.background: Humanist weddings have been legal in Scotland for over a decade, but in England and Wales they are not legally recognised. Couples wanting to have a Humanist ceremony have to pay to be legally married by a registrar separately to their Humanist ceremony, increasing costs and practicality issues.
attributes.additional_details:
https://humanism.org.uk/ceremonies/non-religious-weddings/faqs/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/sep/17/humanist-weddings-scotland-england-wales

https://humanism.org.uk/2018/05/24/parliamentarians-call-for-legal-humanist-marriages-in-england-and-wales/

attributes.action: Ask the Indian government to take action against the persecution of Christians
attributes.background: India is an ally of the UK and also the world's largest democracy. The UK should ask the Indian government to allow more religious freedom and take action against the rising persecution of Christians at the hands of Hindu radical groups.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/oct/19/orissa-violence-india-christianity-hinduism 

https://www.opendoorsusa.org/christian-persecution/world-watch-list/india/

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious_violence_in_Odisha 

https://www.christiantoday.com/article/hindu-extremists-threaten-to-kill-christians-in-india-if-they-utter-the-name-of-christ/63567.htm 

http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/03/14/christian-persecution-by-hindus-rises-in-india-say-humanitarian-groups.html

attributes.action: Provide vegetarian friendly capsules on the NHS
attributes.background: Every time I have to have medication, I have to ask for liquid or tablets. Then when I speak to either doctors or nurses, they moan that "capsules are cheaper to make." If that is the case, change the capsules to vegetarian friendly capsules.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS should have to buy vegetarian friendly capsules where they are available and must work the drug companies to ensure that all capsules supplied to the NHS are vegetarian friendly. Most vegetarians know that capsules are not vegetarian friendly. So the more people (vegetarians and meat eaters) help to try to fight this change the better it is.

attributes.action: Stop charging NHS workers  to pay for registration renewel
attributes.background: I want action because NHS workers shouldn’t have to pay to go to work. They work long hours with stretched resources, often their is not enough staff with little opportunity for breaks. Both my parents work for the NHS, with my mother having been part of the service for more than 25 years.
attributes.additional_details: Renewing registration can cost practitioners in the NMC £120 per year and practitoners in the hcpc costs £180 for two years registration. They pay the fee despite wage rises being frozen for two years from 2011, and increases capped at 1% until this year. However, despite the proposed pay increases this won’t cover the registration fee and is minimal in comparison to inflation.

attributes.action: Make Senior and 16-25 Railcards follow the same Time & Fare restrictions
attributes.background: The 16-25 Railcard is the same cost and appears to be the same as the Senior Railcard (for over 60's). However, the 16-25 card has a list of restrictions that do not apply to the senior card, including a minimum fare and time restrictions. Why are there not the same allowances?
attributes.additional_details: Apprentices, students & the young in work for the most, have to be up early for Uni/Work etc. and are notoriously hard up, at the start of there careers/working bottom end jobs. However while commuting to work as an apprentice, seeing a senior citizen go from there new range rover to the train, then be receiving a vastly discounted fare for the same journey does not seem fair. There are 2 sides as there are less well off elderly, and youth with money, however why give to one and not the other?

attributes.action: Require phone providers to stop charging for handsets on expiration of contract
attributes.background: The government should make it law that mobile phone providers should be obliged to make sure that any customers staying in a contract past the end of a fixed deal have their monthly bill reduced to reflect the cost of the handset.
attributes.additional_details:
In October 2017 Citizens Advice found that three of the four largest mobile phone providers – Vodafone, EE and Three – continued to charge customers extra for a handset after it had been paid off as part of their fixed deal.  The majority of people who are caught out by this are the over 65s.

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/about-us/how-citizens-advice-works/media/press-releases/mobile-phone-networks-overcharging-loyal-customers-by-up-to-38-a-month/

attributes.action: Allow Industrial Hemp to be grown without a Home Office License (4 plants)
attributes.background: I propose a registered scheme with local police to allow UK adults to grow 4 plants of Industrial Hemp ONLY at home without a Home Office License. With tested seeds that are below 0.2% THC. Allowing individuals to grow safe CBD Hemp at home for personal use only . With labelled & tagged plants.
attributes.additional_details:
Iskedjian et al. Meta-analysis of cannabis based treatments for neuropathic and multiple sclerosis-related pain. Curr Med Res Opin. 23(1):17-24.(2007).
 Bergamaschi et al. Safety and side effects of cannabidiol, a Cannabis sativa constituent. Curr Drug Saf. 2011 Sep 1;6(4):237-49.

The fact there has never been a single recorded case of a death caused by CBD or even a psychotic episode caused by CBD . I am in no way endorsing Recreational Cannabis , but urging you to consider this alternative.

attributes.action: Reform schools’ complaints system
attributes.background: The Department for Education refuse to investigate complaints from innocent students who suffer school bullying or targeting by school staff/other authorities by not obtaining all the relevant records needed for a fair investigation. We need a new body to investigate failures over the last 25 years.
attributes.additional_details: Reform the system as bullying ruins the lives of victims regardless of age or disability this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints from students/parents against schools & local authorities where children have been forced out of school, expelled, parents labelled & false reports made. Sadly, it is a daily occurrence for some schoolchildren and is sometimes so severe that victims lose out on schooling, self-harm or even take their own life. This cannot be right.

attributes.action: Create a criminal offence of filming/observing a crime without helping
attributes.background: Social media, and broader internet space, is being littered with videos, mostly taken on mobile phones, showing assaults on the public and police officers. Quite often, the filmmaker is with a larger group of bystanders, who all stand by and observe the violence but fail to summon help or intervene
attributes.additional_details: Involuntary manslaughter, joint enterprise and gross negligence all deal with bystander type liability. But they require some kind of intent or legal duty. What about those who have no intent to harm anyone, and only owe a moral duty, and not statutory. It’s not acceptable for a person, without a reasonable excuse, to observe harm being done, and fail to get that person help, or if able to, attempt to stop the harm. Filming violence or doing NOTHING should never be acceptable.

attributes.action: Remove hemp from schedule 1 and reclassify as an agricultural crop.
attributes.background: We are calling for the immediate withdrawal of hemp from Schedule 1 and urgent reclassification as an industrial and agricultural crop. It should not be regulated under the Misuse of Drugs Act at all, let alone put in the most restrictive category alongside dangerous class As.
attributes.additional_details: With Brexit looming, the UK needs to become self-reliant for our sources of food, energy, fuel and raw materials. Hemp is the perfect crop to provide all of these. Hemp seeds are a nutritionally complete food. The plant could replace cotton. It's an abundant source of cellulose so can make paper and plastic. It needs no pesticides, pulls carbon from the atmosphere, prevents soil erosion and absorbs toxins from the soil, helping to prevent climate change, and it only takes 3 months to grow.

attributes.action: Ban food waste food away require companies to give it to people who need it
attributes.background: Many companies around the UK throw away waste food at the end of the day away. This needs to stop and the food should be given to people who need it the most, for example homeless people.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 France banned food waste and made it compulsory for supermarkets to donate unsold food to charities. The UK government should enact a similar law.

attributes.action: Stop the Lifetime ISA & allow customers to withdraw their money with no penalty
attributes.background: Lifetime Isas allow adults under 40 to save for their first home or pension in one pot with a 25 per cent bonus from the Government. They were revealed in the 2016 budget and launched in April 2017. However, many are being caught out by the strict withdrawal rules.

attributes.action: Urge newly elected PM Imran Khan to stop persecution of Ahmadi Muslims
attributes.background: All over the world a small sect of Muslims known as the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community are persecuted and oppressed. Perhaps no other place do Ahmadis face worse persecution than in Pakistan.
attributes.additional_details:
In Pakistan oppressive laws mean Ahmadis often live in fear and are denied basic rights. Ahamadis cannot vote, their mosques are often targeted, for example, in 2010 where 86 Ahmadi worshippers were killed during Friday prayers and they can face up to 3 years in jail for calling themselves Muslims. 

Pakistan has just elected a new PM. PM Khan says that he want an just and equal society. There is now a golden opportunity for the UK Government to pressure Khan to address the persecution of Ahmadis.

attributes.action: Make "vlogging" whilst driving illegal
attributes.background: Many youtubers are creating vlog videos whilst driving where they are talking to and looking at their camera and therefore becoming distracted from the road and becoming dangers to themselves and other road users. This will be encouraging others, especially young inexperienced drivers to do the same
attributes.additional_details: Vlogging is a form of online video blog usually shared via YouTube in which an individual talks to a camera, adrressing the audience. 100s of vlogs and drive with me videos can be accessed at the click of button. Those featured in these vlogs are popular young adults acting as role models for young and vulnerable teenagers who won't always realise they can be putting their own and other lives at risk if they are inspired to copy the actions as the youtubers face no consequence for their actions

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for supermarket delivery vehicles to be fully electric.
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement for the big six supermarket retailers in the UK (Tesco's, Sainsbury's, Adsa, Morrisons, Waitrose and Iceland.) to have a fleet of fully electric delivery vehicles by April 2019.
attributes.additional_details: As supermarket delivery vehicles only deliver/operate in city they are based in and surrounding towns & villages they rarely have to travel long distances which means that they would never be too far away from a charging point and when the vehicles are not being used (overnight ect) they can be charged at the supermarket ready for their next job. The electrification of delivery vehicles would help lower pollution levels and help save the earth.

attributes.action: A cycle path should be provided by law when roads are  redeveloped or created
attributes.background: housing estates on east way in Preston lancashire have been built and accompanying pavements but no cyclepaths have been created.

attributes.action: Change the level of proof for suicide verdicts to "on balance of probabilities"
attributes.background: Reaching a verdict of suicide demands the case must be made ‘beyond reasonable doubt’, the criminal standard of proof. This skews the figures hiding hundreds more suicides. If the level of proof were changed, there would be greater urgency to fund mental health services for young people.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 there were 6,639 suicides in the UK and Republic of Ireland, but we still believe that there were more that weren't recorded. Half of the people with mental health problems as adults present with symptoms by the age of 14. But only 8% of mental health funding goes to services for children and young people. If these numbers were highlighted we believe that more could be done to alleviate the problems and reduce the risk of someone taking their own life, and not looked upon as a sin.

attributes.action: Ensure that AFCS pays out for service injury AND the impact to life and family
attributes.background: Currently AFCS pays out for service related injuries. However it does not take into account the impact on life and that of the family. This change would bring the scheme more in line with civilian personal injury claims.

attributes.action: UK government should provide visa facilities in Afghanistan.
attributes.background: UK government should provide visa facilities in Afghanistan for allBritish Afghan to make an application apply for spouse visa,  settlement visa, students visa  and visit visa in Afghanistan. UK government does not provide visa facilities In Afghanistan.
attributes.additional_details:
It's very difficult for every Afghans have to travel to the nearest countries Pakistan or India to apply for visa, their passports gets submitted and they get stuck without passport for minimum few months.
Most of the visa applications are family settlement, spouse visa, where someone has to travel with them most probably husband from the UK. Financial costs are huge, Around £9000.00 easy to spend and also with out job for few months until get back to UK.

attributes.action: No more than 1 junction or 5 miles of roadworks, on a motorway or  A road
attributes.background:
This causes a lot of congestion and stand still traffic, there is more likely to be a road traffic incident in roadworks. 
Most of the time road works are only been worked on in a 1 mile stretch, there is no need for so many miles to be closed for years and years
attributes.additional_details:
M6- over 20 miles of motorway 2 miles of workers max, incidents at least 1 aday, 
M5 1 junction 2-3,bridge repairs hardly any incidents and not as much congestion

attributes.action: Re-introduce free milk in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: Free milk was a great way of making children that little bit happier about going to school, so now I believe we should reintroduce it back to schools

attributes.action: Limit new drivers 1100cc- first 12 mths, 14000cc-12-24 mths, 1600cc-24-36 mths
attributes.background: The cost of insurance is too high and the volume of accidents involving young drivers is also too high, bringing this in would hopefully reduce both

attributes.action: Require all schools to provide a trouser alternative during summer periods.
attributes.background: All schools should be legally obliged to provide all students with a trouser alternative; although traditionally formal customs be respected, it is ridiculous that many individuals are not provided with alternative uniforms options, such as shorts, during hotter summer periods.
attributes.additional_details: Many schools throughout the country simply do not provide students with uniform alternatives for hotter weather periods, as a result thousands of students find it particularly hard to concentrate are learn effectively during their academic experience. Being forced to overheat due to schools not providing cooler uniform alternatives is patently absurd - as such, all schools most make a summer suitable uniform for their students.

attributes.action: Require all buses to have seat belts
attributes.background: Buses have crashes and make sudden stops and people get injured all the time because they are not wearing seat belts.
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was involved in a bus accident (not the bus driver’s fault) where a taxi pulled out. This resulted in me being thrown from my chair and suffering bruised ribs and jarred my chest. This is why all buses should be required to have seat belts.

attributes.action: Create a medal for those injured or killed whilst in service or on operations
attributes.background: I want the introduction of a medal to be automatically awarded to those members of the UK armed forces, and security and emergency services injured or killed whilst serving in any capacity during the course of their service or whilst on operations

attributes.action: Increase the annual salary of all public sector workers by 3%.
attributes.background:
We, the people of Britain, would like to request an increase of the annual salary for all public sector workers by 3%. In particular, the pay wage of Police, Firefighters and workers of the NHS. 

We feel that the wages should be increased because of the heroic services they provide everyday.
attributes.additional_details:
"The starting salary for Police Officers in England, Wales and Northern Ireland is between £19,971 and £23,124, rising to £38,382 at the top of the scale - achievable after about seven years.."

"Public Sector workers help you when you need it, no matter how bad of a situation. Some make you feel safe and risk their whole life for us, saving lives. They train and dedicated their life to make sure the people of Britain are safe and secure in the area that they live. They deserve more." - Nameless

attributes.action: Remove the VAT on purchase of defibrillators
attributes.background: Encourage the purchase of these life saving devices. Small communities are raising funds to buy these defibrillators for no reason other than to save life. Maybe yours, maybe mine, or maybe a loved one. Remove the tax and encourage the acquisition of this life saving and life changing technology

attributes.action: Protect pension funds from asset strippers by closing Companies Act loopholes.
attributes.background: Under s172 Companies Act 2006, directors must "promote the success of the company" taking into account the long term consequences and the need to act fairly with stakeholders, such as employees. However, Part 23 of the Act fails to prevent the asset-stripping of companies by the unscrupulous.
attributes.additional_details:
Fixed assets should be recorded at fair value before assets are transferred out of the company and the non-distributable revaluation reserve created should remain with the company.
Non-distributable reserves converted to distributable reserves should be accounted for as unrealized profit for dividend purposes and not appropriated from the company. 
Accumulative distributable reserves should be restricted to cover the current pension fund deficit before further distributions are considered.

attributes.action: Make it standard at your 12 week fetal scan that your cervix is also measured
attributes.background: I am currently 23 weeks pregnant.I had my 20 week scan last week.Due to current testing at my hospital they also measured my cervix(which isn't standard practice).My cervix was measuring 6mm instead of approx.4cm.This may have been picked up on previous scan earlier on and prevented such a high risk
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 20 pregnancies experience shortening of the cervix which may lead to late miscarriage or preterm labour. The sooner this is found, the more time hospitals have to try and prevent the cervix getting worse.

attributes.action: Allow all shops (regardless of size) to open for only 6 hours on a Sunday.
attributes.background: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for up to any 6 consecutive hours on a Sunday, because Sunday is a special day for families to get together. To protect the high street, the government should also ban home deliveries for online shopping on a Sunday.
attributes.additional_details: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for any 6 hours on Sundays and the government should force all shops (regardless of size) to close on Easter Sunday and on Christmas Day when it falls on a Sunday. The only exceptions should be petrol stations that only sell fuel, airport shops (past security), pharmacies and shops on seagoing ships.

attributes.action: Reverse 20 years long residency rule to 14 years residency to legalise status.
attributes.background:
Thousands are affected with this rule as it forces individuals to spend their whole life here to get indefinite leave to remain.
So if a person arrives here in his early 20s, he has to spend 20 years of his life to apply only for leave to remain following 3 more leave to remains for next 10 years.
attributes.additional_details:
This rule is a cruel step towards humanity as expecting someone to spend half of his life in United Kingdom with no means, no job, no driving licence and doing odd jobs to survive is against article 8: ‘your right to a private and family life’.
Before July 2012, the rule was 14 years long residency before one used to apply for indefinite leave to remain to settle here unconditionally which was not much bad period.
But Prime Minister Theresa May changed this 14 years long residency with 20 years.

attributes.action: Stop private parking companies from imposing fines after you leave the premises.
attributes.background: Parliament should legislate to stop Private Parking Companies from imposing penalty charges after a vehicle has left the location where enforcement is in place.
attributes.additional_details:
Private parking companies should only be able to impose a charge on the spot or must install barriers at entry and exit points to accept payment.
 
Issuing notices by post should be prohibited. 
 
It is a simple solution to a very controversial industry.

attributes.action: Give apt psychological & CBT therapy on NHS to struggling with Asperger Syndrome
attributes.background: People with Asperger Syndrome and other conditions are being denied 1 to 1 appropriate Psychological & Cognitive Behaviour Therapy, even though they may have other conditions e.g. mental health problems. This has a serious impact and prevents them from leading a full balanced life.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS does not currently offer 1 to 1 talking therapies to those with Asperger Syndrome, irrespective of other mental health issues. The Government and NICE to ensure that those in need, requiring such appropriate talking therapies are treated equally to those requiring an operation. The requirement to be deemed as appropriate by the patient and/or a Health Professional/Clinician and/or Social Workers. Those with Asperger Syndrome when needed, be able to access it in a timely manner, as part of an ‘Overall HOLISTICAL approach’ for as long as it is required to work through direct and associated issues, to a measurable outcome & life balance.

attributes.action: Allow Left turns on red like in the USA
attributes.background: So in the USA you can legally turn Right on a red light which helps with easing traffic and lowering co2 emmisons So I think that when applicable We should be allowed to turn left on red due to us driving on the left side of the road. This would greatly decrease co2 emmisons and traffic in cities.

attributes.action: british soldier should be free from prosecution unless dishonourably discharged
attributes.background: No British soldier should ever face criminal charges whilst in the execution of his duties within the armed forces, whether within the british isles or abroad. This should apply across the board and be retrospective save for those who are dishonourably discharged.
attributes.additional_details: Scurrilous accusations are inevitable and it is disgraceful that governments past and present have not seen fit to prevent the prosecution of men and women who have risked their very lives for the uniform and the people they serve.
